summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing email from March 3, 2022. It contains a summary of a news article reporting on the conviction of Ghislaine Maxwell for sex trafficking in connection with Jeffrey Epstein. The briefing also lists other news topics and congressional hearing schedules.

events.title: News Report on Ghislaine Maxwell Conviction
events.description: The Independent publishes an article reporting on Ghislaine Maxwell's conviction for sex trafficking in connection with Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI Daily News Briefing
events.description: The FBI distributes its daily news briefing, which includes a summary of the article on Maxwell's conviction.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was convicted on five of six counts, including sex trafficking, for her role in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse scheme.
The conviction was based on testimony from four women who described being abused as teens in the 1990s and early 2000s at Epstein's homes.
Maxwell faces up to 65 years in prison, and her lawyers vowed to appeal the verdict.
The trial was seen as a reckoning Epstein never had and a high-profile case in the wake of the #MeToo movement.
The victims were as young as 14 years old.
